message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses issues related to trust and identity in the modern Internet, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper proposes a solution for decentralizing trust through attribute-based delegation, which involves the use of distributed systems and access control, which falls under the categories of distributed computing (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE). The paper also discusses the use of attribute storage and resolution systems, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes the use of the GNU Name System (GNS) for secure attribute-based delegation, which falls under the category of systems and information theory (cs.SI).
